execution_plan.title: ROG Strix 16 to Android Phone VR Movie Streaming Setup
execution_plan.overview: Stream movies from ROG Strix 16 laptop to Android phone for VR goggle viewing in a virtual theater environment

devices: Android phone with VR goggle compatibility
prerequisites.network: Both devices on same WiFi network (5GHz recommended for best performance)
prerequisites.storage: Movies stored on laptop hard drive

steps.title: Prepare Laptop Environment
steps.description: Set up the ROG Strix 16 laptop for optimal streaming performance

actions.details: Ensure laptop is connected to 5GHz WiFi band if available for better streaming performance
actions.command: Check Network & Internet settings > WiFi properties

actions.details: Set power plan to 'High Performance' or 'Balanced' to prevent throttling during streaming
actions.command: Control Panel > Power Options > Select High Performance plan

actions.details: Ensure movies are in a known location and in compatible formats (MP4, MKV, AVI)
actions.command: Create/verify folder path for movies (e.g., C:\Movies)

actions.details: Ensure Windows Firewall allows local network connections
actions.command: Settings > Windows Security > Firewall & network protection

validation_criteria: Laptop connected to WiFi (preferably 5GHz)
Power plan set to prevent sleep during streaming
Movie files accessible and in supported formats
Firewall not blocking local network traffic

risks.mitigation: Move closer to router or use WiFi extender

steps.title: Install Streaming Software on Laptop
steps.description: Install and configure server software for screen/media streaming

recommended_solutions.name: Plex Media Server + Plex VR
recommended_solutions.pros: Dedicated VR theater app, best quality, media organization

recommended_solutions.name: VLC + Screen Mirroring (Miracast/DLNA)
recommended_solutions.cons: Basic VR experience, may need additional apps

recommended_solutions.name: Skybox VR + SMB/DLNA Server
recommended_solutions.pros: Excellent VR video player, supports network streaming
recommended_solutions.cons: Phone app is paid (free version limited)

steps.recommended_approach: Option A (Plex) for best VR theater experience

actions.details: Visit plex.tv/downloads and download Windows version
Run installer with default settings, create free Plex account if needed
Add movie folder as a library in Plex
steps: Open Plex Web App (http://localhost:32400/web)
Click 'Add Library' > Movies
Browse to movie folder location
Click 'Add' to scan and organize movies

actions.details: Allow access from phone on local network
actions.command: Plex Settings > Network > Enable 'Enable server support for insecure connections on localhost'

validation_criteria: Plex Media Server installed and running
Movie library added and scanned successfully
Can access Plex web interface at localhost:32400
Movies visible in Plex library

risks.risk: Port conflicts if other media servers installed
risks.mitigation: Close other media server applications or change Plex port

steps.rollback: Uninstall Plex Media Server from Control Panel > Programs and Features

steps.title: Set Up Android Phone
steps.description: Install VR apps and streaming client on Android phone

actions.details: Ensure at least 500MB free space and 50%+ battery (or charger available)
Connect phone to same WiFi network as laptop
actions.command: Settings > WiFi > Connect to same network

actions.details: Download official Plex app from Google Play Store
Install dedicated VR version for better theater experience
actions.note: Plex VR may not be available - use regular Plex app + VR video player as alternative

actions.details: Install Skybox VR Player or VaR's VR Video Player as backup
options: Skybox VR Player (recommended, has free version)
actions.command: Play Store > Search app name > Install

actions.details: Disable auto-brightness and set brightness to comfortable level for VR
actions.command: Settings > Display > Brightness (50-70%), Disable adaptive brightness

actions.action: Enable Developer Options and USB Debugging (optional)
actions.details: For troubleshooting if needed
actions.command: Settings > About Phone > Tap Build Number 7 times

validation_criteria: Phone connected to same WiFi as laptop
Plex app installed and can sign in
VR video player app installed
Screen brightness set appropriately
Phone has sufficient battery/charging

risks.risk: Phone overheating during extended VR use
risks.mitigation: Take breaks, ensure phone ventilation, reduce brightness

risks.risk: Apps not compatible with phone model
risks.mitigation: Try alternative VR apps from Play Store

steps.title: Connect Phone to Laptop Media Server
steps.description: Establish connection between Plex app and laptop server

actions.details: Open Plex app and sign in with same account used on laptop
Plex should auto-discover server on local network
steps: Tap menu icon (≡) in Plex app
Look for server name under 'Servers'
Should show laptop's Plex server name

actions.details: Add server manually using laptop's IP address
steps: Find laptop IP: Open Command Prompt > type 'ipconfig' > note IPv4 Address
In Plex app: Settings > Server > Manual Connection
Enter: http://[LAPTOP_IP]:32400

actions.details: Verify movies are accessible from phone
actions.validation: Navigate to Movies library and see movie list

actions.details: Play a movie normally to verify streaming works

validation_criteria: Phone Plex app connected to laptop server
Movie library visible on phone
Test movie plays without buffering issues
Streaming quality is smooth (adjust if needed)

risks.mitigation: Use manual IP connection method, check firewall settings
Move closer to router, reduce video quality in Plex settings, use 5GHz WiFi

steps.rollback: Disconnect from server in Plex app settings

steps.title: Configure VR Viewing Mode
steps.description: Set up VR theater mode for movie watching

actions.details: Open Skybox VR or chosen VR app on phone

actions.action: Configure network streaming in VR app
actions.details: Add laptop as network source
steps_for_skybox: Enter laptop IP and shared folder credentials
OR use Plex plugin if available
steps_for_plex_native: Use Plex app's VR mode if available
Some versions have built-in VR theater view
Look for VR icon or 360° video options

actions.action: Alternative: Use screen mirroring to VR browser
actions.details: If direct VR playback not working, use web browser in VR
steps: Install 'Firefox Reality' or 'Oculus Browser' equivalent for Cardboard
Open Plex web interface in VR browser: http://[LAPTOP_IP]:32400/web
Play movie in browser VR mode

actions.details: Configure theater size, screen distance, and environment
settings: Void mode or theater mode based on preference

actions.details: Play a short movie clip to verify VR theater works
actions.validation: Put phone in VR goggle and check comfort and visibility

validation_criteria: VR app can access movie files from laptop
Movies play in VR theater mode
Screen is centered and comfortable to view
No significant lag or stuttering
Audio and video are synchronized

risks.mitigation: Start with short sessions, adjust screen distance, ensure smooth framerate

risks.risk: Phone doesn't fit properly in VR goggle
risks.mitigation: Adjust goggle straps, use phone without case if too thick

steps.title: Optimize and Test Full Experience
steps.description: Fine-tune settings for best VR movie watching experience

actions.details: Balance quality vs. performance based on WiFi speed
recommendations: For strong WiFi: Original quality or 1080p
For moderate WiFi: 720p (recommended for most VR)
Adjust in Plex app: Settings > Quality > Maximum

actions.details: Set up audio for VR experience
options: Connect wired headphones to phone (best quality/no lag)

actions.details: Watch 10-15 minutes to verify stable streaming
Document optimal settings for future sessions
items_to_note: Preferred VR app and theater configuration

validation_criteria: Complete 15+ minute test viewing without issues
Audio and video quality are satisfactory
Setup is reproducible for future sessions
No overheating or battery concerns

risks.mitigation: Take 10-15 minute breaks every hour, adjust goggle fit

wired_connection.description: Use USB-C to HDMI adapter + capture card (more complex, lower latency)
wired_connection.when_to_use: If WiFi streaming is too laggy or unreliable

direct_file_transfer.description: Copy movie files directly to phone storage
direct_file_transfer.when_to_use: If streaming performance is poor and phone has sufficient storage
steps: Connect phone to laptop via USB
Copy movie files to phone's Movies folder
Play locally using VR video player app
direct_file_transfer.cons: Limited by phone storage, manual file management

cloud_streaming.description: Upload movies to cloud service and stream to phone
cloud_streaming.when_to_use: For mobile VR viewing away from home
cloud_streaming.cons: Requires upload time, internet bandwidth, may have costs

solutions: Verify both devices on same WiFi network and subnet
Disable VPN on laptop or phone
Temporarily disable Windows Firewall to test
Use manual IP connection method
Restart Plex Media Server service
Check router settings for AP isolation (disable if enabled)

issue_2.problem: Streaming is laggy or buffering frequently
solutions: Move closer to WiFi router
Switch to 5GHz WiFi band
Lower video quality in Plex settings
Close other applications on laptop
Restart router
Check for background downloads/uploads
Use direct file transfer method instead
Take regular breaks
Lower screen brightness
Close background apps on phone
Remove phone case for better ventilation
Use a VR goggle with better ventilation
Avoid charging phone while in VR use

issue_4.problem: VR mode not available or not working
solutions: Try alternative VR video player apps
Use web browser in VR mode
Check app permissions (storage, network)
Update VR apps to latest version
Verify phone supports VR features

issue_5.problem: Audio out of sync with video
solutions: Use wired headphones instead of Bluetooth
Adjust audio delay in VR app settings if available
Try different video player
Convert video file to different format
Reduce video quality to improve processing

rollback_strategy.description: How to revert changes if setup doesn't work
steps: Uninstall Plex Media Server from laptop: Control Panel > Programs > Uninstall
Uninstall VR apps from phone: Long-press app > Uninstall
Remove Plex account if created and not needed
Restore laptop power settings to previous state
Delete copied movie files from phone if using direct transfer method
rollback_strategy.data_preservation: No user data is modified, movies remain in original location

primary: Can browse and select movies from phone while connected to laptop server
Movies stream smoothly with minimal buffering
VR theater mode provides comfortable viewing experience
Setup can be repeated for future viewing sessions
secondary: Can watch full-length movie (90+ minutes) without issues
Phone battery lasts for movie duration or can charge during use

post_setup_recommendations: Create bookmark/shortcut for Plex web interface on laptop
Keep VR apps updated for bug fixes and improvements
Organize movies in Plex with proper metadata for easy browsing
Consider upgrading to Plex Pass for additional features (offline sync, etc.)
Experiment with different VR theater environments for variety
Invest in better VR headset if enjoying the experience (Google Daydream, Samsung Gear VR, etc.)

recommended_option.accessories: $10-30 (better VR headset, Bluetooth headphones if needed)
